resources.string: Send Text will process a string, passing it through the Text To Speech functionality of Android before sending the rendered text to the Alexa server. This is treated just like human speech, but because of the issues of the extra layer, the success rate is not as high as sending raw audio. Additionally this process takes longer due to the extra layer..

Press the button to send request.


Sending prerecorded audio will be the fastest way to connect to the Alexa servers, but it's also the least flexible. It takes a raw audio file and uploads it directly without any other user interaction. This example plays the recorded value: "Tell me a joke."
Press the microphone to start recording. Recording will end either when pressed again or end of speech detected.
